attributes.action: Make the National Living Wage apply to people aged 21 or older not 25 or older.
attributes.background:
Adults in the workplace who are under 25 will be paid 45p less an hour than adults who are 25+ even if they do the exact same job.

A worker under 25 will be paid Â£810 less a year.
A working adult under 25 has the same bills as everyone else and should be paid the same.
attributes.additional_details: http://m.acas.org.uk/index.aspx?articleid=1902

attributes.action: Ban disturbing photo's on new tobacco packaging
attributes.background:
Ban disturbing photos on new tobacco packaging

New tobacco packaging law became introduced to the UK in May 2016 which concluded that blank packaging would be made for all tobacco products. New photographic images are also in place with new packaging which are incredibly disturbing to the public.
attributes.additional_details:
One packaging strikes myself which is incredibly appalling to be advertised is the packaging 'Smoking kills your unborn child' with a shocking image of a baby coffin with grieving parents looking over the cot. This image is absurd to anyone who may be going through miscarriage/loss child who DO NOT even smoke. 

Ban these shocking images, blank packaging is reasonable without going over the top.

attributes.action: Provide more help for young people trying to start up their own business.
attributes.background: Early stages of my teen life I was on the roads. However due to participating in some workshops provided by my local youth club it opened up doors for me. After a while I started looking at the big picture and saw my actual potential and decided to start up my own brand. We need more of this.
attributes.additional_details: Young people in today's generation are stereotyped to be thugs, thiefs & bad. These kids face a significant amount of gateways into that lifestyles, but where is the gateway to the successful lifestyle? We make it so easy for our kids to join the roads but so difficult to become a business person.

attributes.action: Require companies to give paid & undisclosed leave for Dysmenorrhea(period pain)
attributes.background: The higher the amount 'ill' days an employee or a prospective employee has can negatively affect employment. Symptoms are directly related to being a women. Some would say women need to be able to take days off every month without any record of them not working that day and to be paid in full.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.theguardian.com/lifeandstyle/2016/mar/02/uk-company-introduce-period-policy-female-staff
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-africa-38207846
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/health-37438767

http://www.nhs.uk/conditions/Periods-painful/Pages/Introduction.aspx

attributes.action: Add Sports to the school curriculum
attributes.background: Our nation is known to celebrate sporting achievements in football, golf, rugby, olympics etc. But schools do not support them. We should have sports as part of the subjects chosen in secondary school. This way students who excel at physical activities are able to gain scholarships for their gifts

attributes.action: Increase the age to play the lottery from 16 to 18 the same as other gambling.
attributes.background: I have seen how gambling affects people. A 16 year old could buy a ticket and win millions. This could be dangerous, it could cause them to go off the rails.They could get in with the wrong crowd and be led into a life of drink and drugs.  This amount of money should be with adult supervision.
attributes.additional_details: You have to be 18 to gamble in this country, for example fruit machines, betting shops and casinos. Why is the lottery any different?

attributes.action: Make teaching 'Children's Rights' compulsory in all schools.
attributes.background: There are a list of more than 40 rights, which each child has. Most children don't even know these rights exist. Teaching children's rights in schools will inform all children of the rights they have.

attributes.action: Government must restrict FIFA officials travel to the UK pending a full apology
attributes.background: It is at the government's discretion to restrict access to the UK of those deemed to be unconducive to the public interest. FIFA decision to enter into disciplinary proceedings against both the English & Scottish teams for wearing the universal emblem of remembrance the poppy is just that.
attributes.additional_details: Civilised cultures remember those who made the ultimate sacrifice in defending freedom, the wearing of the poppy isn't restricted to remembering British fallen but those of the commonwealth and respect of those who thought against us in the hope their sacrifice wasn't in vain. The poppy isn't a political image but one of hope/respect and even reconsideration. Any travel ban on FIFA officials should stand until such time as a full and unconditional apology is made to both nations teams by FIFA.

attributes.action: Call to ban any form of media that incites xenophobia, racism or hate.
attributes.background: There should be no tolerance to established media holding extreme, sensationalist views that provoke racial segregation, inequality and hatred toward others.
attributes.additional_details: In 2016 we should not be using or allowing history to be a light suggestion of how to move forwards in becoming a more balanced and fair society that extends its care not just to the perimeters of its own towns and countries but to the entire world. We live in a multicultural society that extends to a multicultural world and we cannot continue to allow low rate tabloids or any other form of media to provoke anger in to people that gives rise to views of racism and segregation and fuels hatred.

attributes.action: Lower the sound limit of fireworks that can be sold to the public 50 decibels
attributes.background: A petition has recently gone around asking to ban the sale of fireworks to the public, and the response has been somewhat disappointing. As a compromise we are asking to lower the sound limit from 120 to 50 decibels to minimise stress on animals and people.

attributes.action: Close all retail stores on New Year's Day
attributes.background: New Year's Day is the day after we celebrate the year before and can't do that if we are at work

attributes.action: Call on the Government not to spend further public money on the Olympic stadium.
attributes.background:
The original structure became the new home of West Ham United from last August. The conversion costs Â£272m, of which the football club will pay just Â£15m plus annual rent of Â£2.5m, bringing the final price tag to Â£702m. 

Problems with the seating will now cost the tax payer more millions to fix
attributes.additional_details: The government preferred to produce a brief for an athletics only stadium which would be largely disassembled after the games with the lower tier remaining in place as a permanent athletics facility to replace the Crystal Palace National Sports Centre. With the original Olympic design finalised and being built, the government had a change of heart and a bidding process for a multi-sport post-Olympic legacy was launched.

attributes.action: Lower the curfew of fireworks to 9pm on a normal night
attributes.background: The curfew for fireworks should be lowered to 9pm on a normal night because little children go to bed at 9pm & dogs will not be afraid for too long & their owners will be able to get to sleep not worrying about there pets.

attributes.action: I would like the Government to reinstate Child Support Agency!
attributes.background: We need a government run Child Support Agency as the so called Child Maintenance Service is not meeting the correct criteria. Causing a high level of financial suffering for the parent who is raising the child/children. The absent parent is not being forced to supply correct financial  information.

attributes.action: i would like to propose one day a year where all commercial flights are banned.
attributes.background: Reports have been released showing the extent that the flight ban after 9/11 had on climate change. These reports show promising figures of an overall drop of average temperature. I believe that by banning non necessary and commercial flights for one day a year could help to slow down global warming
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.greenmedinfo.com/blog/artificial-weather-revealed-post-9-11-flight-groundings 
http://globalnews.ca/news/2934513/empty-skies-after-911-set-the-stage-for-an-unlikely-climate-change-experiment/
i have supplied two sources which both support my claim however many more are available with a simple google search.

attributes.action: All councils and H/A should offer any new build properties to existing tenants
attributes.background: all councils and associations should offer new build properties to existing tenants who have lived in older properties for over 10 years and are up to date with the rent accounts in order for them to be able to upgrade and older properties offered to new tenants
attributes.additional_details: Social housing tenants are stuck now if you want to move it's pretty much a no go unless you have exceptional circumstances you could do mutual exchange but if you are in a older house there's little Chance as most want new builds if councils were to offer new builds to existing long term tenants it would mean that if they wanted to upgrade or move area the choice is there new tenants to be offered the older properties

attributes.action: Make all retail and commercial premises prominently display their street numbers
attributes.background: Most shops and commercial premises fail to display their street numbers at all, making it very difficult to find them by address. This adds to high street congestion, pollution and potential for accidents by distracted drivers. Prominently displaying their street number should be a legal requirement

attributes.action: Dedicate more funds to the development of the city of Birmingham.
attributes.background: Too much of the British economy is centered around London. To counter this I suggest dedicating funds to the improvement and expansion of the city of Birmingham as it already has a substantial population, and has the potential to become a new economic and financial hub, strengthening the economy.
attributes.additional_details: The city of San Francisco in the U.S is a major tourist attraction and financial hub, yet it is smaller than Birmingham. If the government was too attract more buisnesses to the area, build more attractions and increase the amount of tall buildings to make it appear more of a global city, then I believe we would see a similar effect. Expanding the airport to fly directly to more cities would also bolster this effect. This would generate far more revenue and give Britain a substantial 2nd city.

attributes.action: removal of traffic commissioners powers to suspend, revoke driving licences
attributes.background: when you get an offence like an TS10 and after you have paid the fixed penalty and received the points, you are called up to the traffic commissioner nearly 3 years after the fact and she decides to suspend your licence while under a high court ruling this can only happen for a maximum of 21 days.
attributes.additional_details: the traffic  has suspended licences for 22 years according to DVLA they have had letters from VOSA through the traffic commissioner to suspend a licence until the holder is 70 years of age under current law this can only be done for a maximum of 21 day through a high court ruling or 12 month through the totting up of more that 12 penalty points

attributes.action: To change the education system to ensure all students benefit
attributes.background:
What needs to be done: 
-	The amount of memorization needed to do well in the subject needs to be reduced.
-	Courses should focus more on coursework due to the stress of exams.
-	The core subjects need to be changed in order to benefit the child outside of qualification.
attributes.additional_details:
A focus on memorization leads to a bias towards students who have a good memory, but not necessarily a good understanding. The amount of information needed to memorise has recently been increased by Ofqual.

Coursework has recently been removed completely from all non-practical subjects. This increases stress drastically to the point where it may have physical effects. Many students also struggle to perform under stressful conditions which means they do not get results that reflect their ability.

attributes.action: Prevent reverse charging on mobile phone contracts unless consent is given first
attributes.background: The current laws allow anyone with your mobile number, who sets up a business through the regulator, to charge you too "Receive" texts that cost you money without your consent.  Some of these are on the proviso that you opt-out of something you haven't even requested.
attributes.additional_details:
It should not be possible to charge you to receive texts until the user has opted-in, by responding to a text message instead of just receiving it, and mobile network operators should be forced to disable reverse charge billing if requested by the bill payer.

Mobile network operators should also be made to publish their involvement in these companies as well as the profits that they make from them as there is clearly a conflict of interest.

attributes.action: Restrict private parking charges to reasonable amounts.
attributes.background: It is proposed that the government amend the Protection of Freedom Act 2014 to restrict the amount a private company can issue a parking charge to a fair and reasonable amount and no more than what the local council can issue a penalty notice.
attributes.additional_details:
Every day many parking charge notices are issued to vehicles parking on private land. Normally, the fee to cover the car is a reasonable nominal amount. However, for those that overstay the period the vehicle is covered or parking the car without any cover the charges are unreasonable and far more than the loss of business the proprietor suffers. 

The everyday person in the United Kingdom that uses parking facilities lawfully but from time to time cannot cover their car for entirely adequate reasons are suffering unreasonable financial burdens.

attributes.action: Have one NHS distribution centre and buying in bulk whilst making cheaper deals.
attributes.background: We need to have one NHS distribution centre sending all the medical equipment and medicines to each individual hospital. Buying in bulk,getting better and more controled deals. Stoping different hospitals paying different prices,hopefully saving millions. The NHS deserves a better deal,and so do we!

attributes.action: If 20% of a workforce are claiming tax credits  no dividend to shareholders
attributes.background: Any Company  paying its workers so low that they are subsidizing their wages with tax credits, should be barred from paying a dividend. The taxpayer should not be propping up greedy bosses that should  be paying correct wages  to the workers not  to shareholders

attributes.action: We want a government run school bus system similar to America's.
attributes.background: As a student I understand the ridiculous bus prices which we have to pay to even go to school. I believe that as we have a right to education it is wrong that parents have to pay up to Â£12 a day For us to go school. As well as this students who ride on private coaches have to pay up to Â£300 a year.
attributes.additional_details:
I know a student who has three siblings going to the same school. His mother has to pay Â£8.85 each day just for her children to go to school. 

I believe that the American system of having government run school buses is greatly superior to our system now.

I understand like most things in this world this will cost money, my suggestion is to raise council tax by Â£1-3 and use that money to set up a government run bus system. There are 27 million households in the UK, meaning Â£81 million a month.

attributes.action: Stop live music venues being closed by house buyers who chose to live there.
attributes.background: Fewer venues are open for musicians to play in because of home owners who complain AFTER buying.  The venue is then closed. Buyers should sign an acknowledgment of the venue as part of the buying process.
attributes.additional_details: Musicians have few places left to play.  This will be to the detriment of our potentially rich live music future and will effect tourism and local culture.  When all music venues are gone, the same people who complained about noise will bemoan it's loss.

attributes.action: Decrease the required number of signatures for a debate by 10,000
attributes.background: With a gap of 90,000 signatures between an out-ruling response and a fair debate, there are becoming unacceptable amounts of valid opinions on law and rights shared by thousands upon thousands, which don't get a look in. Shredding this by a mere 10,000 is reasonable in context.

attributes.action: Introduce Entry Level Apprenticeships
attributes.background: We would like to initiate a scheme that allows access to entry level apprenticeships for those who may not achieve a level one qualification, Entry level apprenticeships would give these young people a future within well paid , skilled vocational jobs.
attributes.additional_details:
Many young people find school a difficult learning experience, some have the disadvantage of a learning disability, ASD, mental health issues  and or EHC plans which are not fit for purpose, as some young people's progression is slower and requires additional support. Some just have talents that are more vocational. Not everybody is naturally gifted at Maths, English and Sciences.
However, the system works to add to their disadvantages by favouring those who are more academic. It is very difficult for these young people to gain access to an apprenticeship because these require a level 1 grade,on completeion, in numeracy and literacy.

attributes.action: Stop employment agencies using incremental holiday pay as part of basic rate.
attributes.background: Recruitment agencies, particularly within the construction industry, agree a basic rate and then make that rate up of a lower basic rate up of a lower rate plus incremental holiday pay. This is common practice, but the law clearly states that holiday pay must be a "true addition" to the basic rate.

attributes.action: Â£500 tax allowance,every 4 yrs for sport for either membership fee or equipment.
attributes.background: To capitalize on the excitement of the Olympics, every 4 yrs a Â£500 tax free allowance per person could be allocated to spend on  either sports membership (golf for an example) or sport equipment. This will prevent certain sports being only available to the well off.

attributes.action: Introduce a new and robust system of dealing with judicial misconduct
attributes.background: The rules which govern judicial misconduct exclude any decisions made by a judge in the course of proceedings. For example, the personal decisions of judges knowingly and purposively to falsify a claim or to make misleading records in court documents are all classified as "judicial decisions".
attributes.additional_details: The rules do not distinguish between judicial case management and judicial case manipulation. Judicial misconduct is now defined as little more than rudeness.  A judicial decision is now almost any personal decision made by a judge in  court. There is no constituted body which ensures everyone's basic right to a fair and public hearing by an independent and impartial tribunal, or the right to an honest, accurate and unbiased record or that judges must be impartial and seen to be impartial.

attributes.action:
make it mandatory to show on ALL products:
- manufacturer
- origin
attributes.background:
Please make it mandatory for all products sold in the UK to display
- manufacturer name
- country of origin
this should apply to products sold under supermarkets' name as well.
for example 
fridge from electronic shop chain named Sandstorm does not show manufacturer and its country of origin!

attributes.action: Remove the engine size limit on A1 motorcycle license
attributes.background:
Currently the A1 license has three limitations
* maximum 11 kW
* power-to-weight ratio not more than .1 kW
* must not be more than 125 cc
Whereas the A2 license only has two
Some motorscooters/motorcycles may have over 125cc yet still produce under 11 kW yet adhere to the power limit set by A1
attributes.additional_details:
For example, these currently sold vehicles:

Piaggio Vespa PX150
LML Star 151
LML Star 200 

adhere to the power-to-weight ratio and kW limitations of the A1 license.  Changing the A1 criteria to remove the engine size limit brings it in-line with the A2 license (which is also without engine size limit) and gives a further incentive to pass the A1 test rather than ride on a L-plate under a CBT thus improving road safety

attributes.action: Introduce a "safe for the road" certification system for both riders and horses.
attributes.background: Horses are large animals and potentially dangerous on the roads, especially  to pedestrians and cyclists. The level of rider skill, and the temperament of the animals is enormously varied. Most horse riders are able and considerate but a significant minority are not.

attributes.action: Co-ordinate a crowdfund of Tata Steel interests in the UK.
attributes.background: The UK is in danger of losing it's Steel industry due to the commercial viability for it's owners, Tata Steel. It is my petition that the UK government negotiate a scrap/asset disposal price from Tata, prepare a crowd-funding campaign for the acquisition and management of these assets.
attributes.additional_details: Furthermore, the crowdfunding campaign should look to raise sufficient additional funds to give a minimum 2 year safety net for the continuation of the business based upon projected revenue streams. For more information on how to support the campaign further please get your friends, employer and any wealthy individuals that you are connected with to visit myopinionpal.com where any funds raised will be used to get more people to support this petition.

attributes.action: Make it mandatory for smart meters to work regardless of supplier
attributes.background: I phoned B Gas and requested to change our gas meter to a smart meter. They stated that unless I bring my electricity to them they can't provide a smart meter. They further stated that if I change the supplier at any time the smart meter will not function due to their accounting system.
attributes.additional_details: All accounting systems are now universal and I feel the Select Committee should question British Gas. Why do they insist on customers bringing their electric supply and not install a smart meter for gas supply only for which they are supplier to the property? It is a very serious issue and I humbly request the Chairman of the Select Committee to question British Gas. I do want a Smart Meter installed without any conditions attached. There is clear indication of the MONOPOLY for energy supply.

attributes.action: Make retesting of all road users compulsory every 5 years to ensure road safety.
attributes.background: With road deaths increased in 2014 by 4% from 2013 to 1775, serious road injuries increasing by 5% in 2014 from 2013 to 22807 and the total of 194,477 casualties of all severities in reported road traffic accidents during 2014 retesting of road users is essential to protecting the roads.
attributes.additional_details: http://tinyurl.com/nkzmbzh shows the evidence. What is proposed is that road users be charged for the retest. If they pass the test they are refunded the entire test fee as they are competent, if they fail they revert to a provisional licence and have to retrain similar to learners. This makes roads safer (priority), increases employment within the DVSA (better for workforce), provides additional income source which can be put on improving the road network in the UK. Winners all round.

attributes.action: Make law and politics a core study in high school; like maths, English & science
attributes.background:
As the popular proverb suggests "knowledge is power."Thus, it seems to me our electorate is powerless! 

We complain about the turnout for elections and that people don't really understand the political and legal systems (especially 18 to 24s). So let's do something about it
attributes.additional_details:
Quite often in elections less than 50% of young people between the ages of 18 & 24 actually vote. Furthermore, it is often less than 70% of eligible voters who actually vote. 

In the general election 2015, 43% of 18 to 24s voted and only 66% of all eligible voters cast a vote. This is not good enough. 

https://www.ipsos-mori.com/researchpublications/researcharchive/3575/How-Britain-voted-in-2015.aspx

attributes.action: Make it illegal for insurance companies to ask about non fault incidences/claims
attributes.background: Insurance premiums are sky high already. It is totally unfair that insurance companies ask about these incidences and charge higher perimiums as a result. They already charge the driver who was at fault a higher premium, why do they also need to penalise the driver who was innocent! This is unfair
attributes.additional_details: These incidents have to be declared for 5yrs! A non fault accident can cause higher premiums for driver for 5 whole years! My insurance was Â£1400 this year with a Â£1350 excess because of 3 non faults in the last 5 years with a 5yr ncb. It looks set to remain this high for 5years, maybe even go up next year. It would have been Â£700 otherwise. People are reduced to not reporting things and sorting it out themselves. Or worse, forced off the road. They have us over a barrel and abuse this power.

attributes.action: Provide funding to food banks to help supply appropriate food to ethnic groups
attributes.background: There is currently a regional situation whereby food bank charities would not supply appropriate food to multiple different ethnic groupsâ requirements, such as Halal. This needs the government's backing as the health of this country's community, can not be left as the responsibility of charities.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for bank and building societies to allow gambling on credit card
attributes.background: I think it should be illegal to gamble on credit cards as it allows vulnerable people to easily get into debt with money that they should have never been allowed to gamble with. People with the addiction can easily use the full amount of credit chasing the previous bet they lost. Puts lives at risk
attributes.additional_details: Please support this, many people need your help. Not only gambling money they can't afford but hiding the truth from people who truly care about them. Making them feel depressed and not knowing where they can turn.

attributes.action: Do not deport Commonwealth Soldiers who served in The British Army Reserve.
attributes.background: Please allow Foreign & Commonwealth Soldiers the automatic right to remain in the UK after four years of service. Don't sanction them to make an application within 28 days to the Home Office or they face deportation, this is an act of injustice.
attributes.additional_details: We fight for Queen & Country so we deserve better.

attributes.action: Repeal the Fixed Term Parliaments Act 2011
attributes.background: The Fixed Term Parliaments Act should be repealed immediately to allow an opportunity to call a snap election. With several obstacles on the horizon for the government, a general election will most likely strengthen its hand and reaffirm the voters support and representation.

attributes.action: Put the risks of having a cot bumper in the SIDS guidelines.
attributes.background: There is many stories out there that cot bumpers are unsafe and can cause death e.g suffocation and strangulation. If this were in the SIDS guidelines parents are made aware of the risks before and after there baby is born.
attributes.additional_details: Prestons Story

attributes.action: Make it that only UK elected officials can vote on legislation before Parliament
attributes.background: When The House of Commons, comprising of publicly elected MPs, debate, and vote in favour of any legislation, The House of Lords, which is a totally unelected body, should not be able to reject, amend, or interfere with said legislation, in any way, other than in an advisory capacity.

attributes.action: School Admissions: Get your child into a school of your choice.
attributes.additional_details:
Two in five local councils have do not have enough school places meaning that there are an increasing number of children not getting into schools of their choice. 

This pressure on the shortage of school places is contributing to larger class sizes and children having to travel further to attend school. 

This petition is a call for unified planning, by the government, to ensure there are enough different types of schools and most importantly school places for our children.

attributes.action: UK Government to encourage President Trump to visit Birmingham
attributes.background: Donald Trump defied all of the odds and is now the president for the United States. Unlike London, Birmingham voted to leave and played a huge part in the Brexit vote. Donald will save us from Brexit thanks to his trade deals.Leave means leave and Trump mean Trump. Lets MAKE BIRMINGHAM GREAT AGAIN!
attributes.additional_details: Birmingham is the second biggest city and one of the most diverse.

attributes.action: Abolish the drivers insurance instead have a insurance based on the car they own
attributes.background: Most of the countries around the world including Europe calculate insurance based on the car you own. Why in England we need to pay insurance based on the driver? Once car is insured any driver with the legal driving license can drive that car! Isn't is so easy? Please support this petition. Thanks

attributes.action: All new cars sold in Britain must have a phone kits installed.
attributes.background: Using mobile phones while driving is seriously dangerous and damages lives. Why canât the government put in a simply law in place, to make all car manufactures install phone kits in to any new sold car. This could possibly save a lot of lives and save even more injuries.

attributes.action: Curb betting adverting around football matches and ban impulse bets.
attributes.background:
A ban should be placed on betting advertising within 30 minutes of the start of football matches; and a ban should be placed on in play and 'impulse' bets and their aggressive advertising.
Firms should be forced to allow 1 minute cooling off period on all bets to stop people betting impulsively
attributes.additional_details:
Since legalisation of advertising for betting in the U.K. we have seen an increase in problematic gambling, coinciding with the rise of betting on apps and the subsequent increase in advertising spend. New demographics are targeted, the industry now intertwined with football and is impossible to ignore.
Companies are now failing in their duty of care to their customers by providing quicker and quicker ways to bet, alongside aggressively advertising odds to encourage impulsive betting patterns.
